TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi serializable beforefieldinit CultureNotFoundException extends System.ArgumentException implements class System.Runtime.Serialization.ISerializable

remarks.para: is thrown whenever the construction of an invalid culture is eventually attempted within a method.
uses the HRESULT COR_E_ARGUMENT, which has the value 0x80070057.

summary.para: The exception thrown when a method is invoked which attempts to construct a culture that is not available on the machine.

MemberSignature.Value: public CultureNotFoundException (string message, Exception innerException);
.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(string message, class System.Exception innerException) cil managed

remarks.para: This constructor initializes the property of the new instance using the value of the parameter. The content of the parameter is intended to be understood by humans. The caller of this constructor is required to ensure that this string has been localized for the current system culture.

An exception that is thrown as a direct result of a previous exception should include a reference to the previous exception in the property. The property returns the same value that is passed into the constructor, or null if the property does not supply the inner exception value to the constructor.

summary.para: Initializes a new instance of the class with a specified error message and a reference to the inner exception that is the cause of this exception.

Docs.param: The error message to display with this exception.
The exception that is the cause of the current exception. If the parameter is not a null reference, the current exception is raised in a catch block that handles the inner exception.
